snippet: Environmental activists largely dismissed the findings of a long-awaited State Department review that concluded the Keystone XL project would have little impact on the rate of development of oil sands.
abstract: Environmental activists largely dismiss findings of long-awaited State Department review that concludes the Keystone XL project, which would send 830,000 barrels of oil a day from Alberta, Canada, to the Gulf Coast, would have little impact on the rate of development of oil sands.

byline.original: By SARAH WHEATON and CORAL DAVENPORT
byline.contributor: Clifford Krauss contributed reporting from Houston.

lead_paragraph: Environmental activists largely dismissed the findings of a long-awaited State Department review that concluded the Keystone XL project would have little impact on the rate of development of oil sands.

headline.main: Pipeline Opponents’ Hopes Now Rest Largely on Kerry
headline.print_headline: Pipeline Opponents’ Hopes Now Rest Largely on Kerry
